early season teething problems continued on Saturday when they lost 2-1 at home to premier league pacesetters Sheffield Wednesday . [h]England[/h] striker Alan Shearer gave Kevin Keegan 's talent-laden side the lead from the penalty spot after 13 minutes after Wednesday

points for the Yorkshire side with a goal 10 minutes from time . To add to Newcastle 's misery , [h]England[/h] striker Les Ferdinand was stretchered off in the second half . Wednesday , who escaped relegation on the final day

Lewis did his best to forget his controversial omission from the England one-day squad on Sunday but could not prevent [h]Pakistan[/h] reasserting their dominance in the final test at The Oval . A super piece of fielding by Lewis , dropped as

measure after arriving only 35 minutes before the start on the fourth morning , provided the only bright spot for [h]England[/h] as the touring team batted on to reach 413 for five at the interval , a lead of 87 .

BASEBALL - ORIOLES WIN , YANKEES LOSE . [h]BALTIMORE[/h] 1996-08-27 Cal Ripken 's bases-loaded walk scored Brady Anderson with the winning run in the bottom of the 10th as

Ripken and gave the Orioles a one-half game lead over the Chicago White Sox in the wild-card race . In [h]Seattle[/h] , Jay Buhner 's eighth-inning single snapped a tie as the Seattle Mariners edged the New York Yankees 2-1 in

of their last 19 games and their lead in the AL East over Baltimore fell to five games . At [h]California[/h] , Tim Wakefield pitched a six-hitter for his third complete game of the season and Mo Vaughn and Troy O'Leary

since August 2nd . The Red Sox are two games over .500 for the first time this season . In [h]Chicago[/h] , Cal Eldred pitched 5-1‐3 scoreless innings and John Jaha scored one run and doubled in another as the Milwaukee
